intro: Zanha, commonly known as the "southern cross" or "bush willow," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rutaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their woody stems and small, often fragrant flowers. Zanha species typically grow as shrubs or small trees, with leaves that are usually simple and alternate. They are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making them resilient to drought conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine for their various therapeutic properties.
